mdRecord.dcterms:title: The undersigned: a member of the General Assembly of Virginia, begs leave to say to you that he is thoroughly convinced that the interest of the State would be greatly promoted by a call of an Extra Session of the Legislature, during the coming winter
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Harvey, Ro. T. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: At head of title: Buffalo, Putnam County, Va., October 25, 1854, To ... [original]
Letter, asking the recipient to sign the request that Joseph Johnson, Governor, will convene a special session of the, General Assembly, and forward the request to Richmond. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: This copy, from the James L. Kemper papers, was never sent. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Virginia. General Assembly. House of Delegates.
